current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit the distribution in commerce of children's products and upholstered
			 furniture containing certain flame retardants, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Children and Firefighters Protection Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Children and Firefighters Protection Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Prohibition on sale of certain products containing specified flame re­tar­dants

term.#tail: have the meanings given such terms in

text.#text: In this section, the terms

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(a) of the Consumer Product Safety Act

text.#text:
It shall be unlawful for any manufacturer, distributor, or retailer to
			 sell, offer for sale, manufacture for sale, distribute in commerce, or
			 import into the United
			 States any children's product or upholstered furniture that
			 contains a flame retardant specified in subsection (c) that exceeds 1,000
			 parts per million total chemical content by weight for any part of the
			 product or furniture.
The flame retardants specified in this subsection are the following:
Tris(1,3-dichloro-2-propyl)phosphate (TDCPP) (chemical abstracts service number 13674–87–8).
Tris(2-chloroethyl)phosphate (TCEP) (chemical abstracts service number 115–1496–8).
Tetrabromobisphenol A (TBBPA) (chemical abstracts service number 79–94–7).
Decabromodiphenyl ether (chemical abstracts service number 1163–19–5).
Antimony trioxide (chemical abstracts service number 1309–64–4).
Hexabromocyclododecane (HBCD) (chemical abstracts service number 25637–99–4).

Bis(2-Ethylhexyl)-3,4,5,6-tetrabromophthalate (TBPH) (chemical abstract service number
			 26040–51–7).
2-EthylhexYl-2,3,4,5-tetrabromobenzoate (TBB) (chemical abstract service number 183658–27–7).
Chlorinated paraffins (chemical abstract services number 85535–84–8).
Tris (1-chloro-2-propyl) phosphate (TCPP) (chemical abstract service number 13674–84–5).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may specify by rule under subsection (d)(5).

consider the potential health effects of such chemical flame retardants, both in isolation and in

examine data and analysis regarding the chemical flame retardants in household dust, indoor air, or
			 elsewhere in the home environment;

review all relevant data, including the most recent, best-available, peer-reviewed, scientific
			 studies of these chemical flame retardants that
			 employ objective data collection practices or employ other objective
			 methods;

consider the amounts of chemical flame retardants used in consumer products and the total volumes
			 manufactured for use;	and

consider possible similar health effects of chemical flame retardants used in children's products
			 or upholstered furniture.

The panel shall, not later than 540 days after the date on which the panel is appointed under
			 paragraph (1), complete an examination of the potential hazards and
			 exposures for the full range of chemical flame retardants that may be used
			 in children's products or upholstered furniture to meet
			 applicable fire safety standards and shall—

shall be reviewed
			 by the panel but shall not be considered determinative.

text.#text: The requirements of

This section shall not annul, alter, or affect a provision of  law of a State relating to the
			 presence of a chemical flame retardant in a children's product or
			 upholstered furniture	except to the extent that such
			 provision of law is inconsistent with a provision of this section, and
			 then only to the extent of the inconsistency. For purposes of this
			 section, a provision of law of a State is not inconsistent with the
			 provisions of this section if the protection such provision of law affords
			 any person is greater than the protection provided under this section.

This Act shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act, except subsection (b) shall
			 take effect on the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act.

Subsection (b) shall
			 apply with respect to children's products and upholstered
			 furniture manufactured after the date that is 1 year after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
